title: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area: First Amendment Activities
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations     First Amendment Activities                First Amendment Activities      In conformity with the rights that are guaranteed in the United States Constitution, the National Park Service manages the right of the people to exercise freedom of speech, and groups to assemble peacefully on park land. Examples of first amendment activities include a church service, political event, or freedom-of-speech activity. Demonstrations involving 25 persons or fewer may be held without a permit within designated park areas. There are no charges if a permit is required.
